title: Figs in Bowl
credit_line: Bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Henry Varnum Poor [1887-1970], New City, NY; Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY [1]; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. [1898-1993] James H. Beal, Pittsburgh, PA, likely by November 1952 until February 14, 1987 [2]; Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones), Pittsburgh, PA, until April 23, 1993; bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1994.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 217 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1952. 
[2]. Mrs. Beal negotiated the purchase of the painting with the Rehn gallery in New York before the opening of the International exhibition (see copies of relevant correspondence in curatorial file.)

creator.death_place: New City (Rockland county, New York state, United States)
